headline.main: Expert Says Being Overweight Doesn't Always Call for Dieting

docs.abstract: Amer Physicians Coll panel on obesity; Prof A Feinstein sees no substantial evidence that weight of 'mildly obese' is harmful to health; scores 'nutritional dogma' of diets; Profs Christakis, Dr J Hirsch comments noted
docs.lead_paragraph: Not everyone has to diet, and a person who is 20 to 30 pounds overweight but is otherwise healthy and happy may best be left alone, a Yale University physician said yesterday.
docs.snippet: Not everyone has to diet, and a person who is 20 to 30 pounds overweight but is otherwise healthy and happy may best be left alone, a Yale University physician said yesterday.
